intro: Paepalanthus rectifolius, commonly known as the straight-leaved puya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of stiff, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces an inflorescence of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
